titles.title: A bill to authorize the Export-Import Bank of the United States to provide financing for the export of nonlethal defense articles and defense services the primary end use of which will be for civilian purposes.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S9122)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking.

committee.name: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

term.name: Export-Import Bank of the United States

bill.summary: 7/15/1994--Introduced. Amends the Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 to allow, provided specified conditions are met, the Export-Import Bank to finance export sales of nonlethal defense articles or services whose primary end use will be for civilian purposes. Requires the Bank to encourage the use of its programs to support the export of goods and services that have beneficial effects on the environment or mitigate potential adverse environmental effects such as by encouraging environmentally sustainable development, promoting efficient use of resources, and promoting energy efficiency. Authorizes appropriations.
